items.title: Britain demands Elon Musk's Grok answers concerns about sexualised photos
items.summary: LONDON, Jan 5 (Reuters) - ‌Britain has demanded Elon Musk's social media site ‌X explain how its AI chatbot Grok was ‌able to produce undressed images of people and sexualised images of children, and whether it was failing in its legal duty ‍to protect users. Read full story

items.title: 8BitDo’s ‘officially supported by Apple’ FlipPad is a flip-style gamepad for mobile gaming
items.summary:
CES 2026 is officially underway, and the announcements are rolling in fast. Now 8BitDo is jumping into the spotlight with a teaser of its brand-new gamepad. The brand is ready to expand its growing controller lineup with FlipPad – a flip-style controller built specifically for mobile gaming. It’s said to be compatible with both iOS and Android devices, and you can hit the jump for a closer look and more details.

items.title: Prep for 2026 with EcoFlow’s New Year Sale and up to 65% power station discounts + bonus savings – all from $86
items.summary:
EcoFlow is ringing in 2026 with its freshly launched New Year Sale and up to 65% discounts on power stations and add-on accessories – plus, there are bonus savings, daily rewards/surprises for members, and more. One notable deal we spotted is EcoFlow’s new DELTA 3 Max Plus Portable Power Station at $996.55 shipped, after using the code 26EFNYAFF at checkout, beating out its Amazon pricing by $52. It launched back in September with an $1,899 MSRP, and normally starts at $1,799 at Amazon, which we’ve consistently seen down at $1,099 during sales, as well as some falls lower to $1,049 and the $997 low (last seen during Black Friday with bonus savings). You’re getting another chance at that same Black Friday low here, with $802 cut from the going rate ($902 off the MSRP) for the best price we have tracked. Head below to browse the full lineup of EcoFlow’s New Year Sale.

The new Anker Nano Charger is comparable in size to the 45W single-port […]

items.title: Venezuela orders police to find, arrest anyone involved in supporting U.S. attack-decree

items.title: Lectric’s extended Holiday Sale returns up to $583 FREE bundles to the XPeak 2.0 off-road e-bikes from $1,499, more
items.summary:
Update 01/05: Lectric has surprisingly extended its Holiday e-bike sale promotions for another week longer! Don’t miss your chance to score your next commuting solution with up to $893 savings.

Lectric eBikes has extended its Holiday e-bike sale for an unknown amount of time longer, but will most likely continue into the new year. Many of the previous deals with up to $893 bundle savings are available, though two of the three models with price cuts have returned to their usual bundle pricing, like the XPeak 2.0 Long-Range Off-Road e-bike and a FREE $583 accessory package at $1,699 shipped. You can also find the standard XPeak 2.0 e-bike with a FREE $434 bundle at $1,499 shipped. These bundles with their e-bikes would normally run you $2,282 and $1,933 at full price, which is not only bringing back Black Friday’s same offers, but also gives you another shot at the largest bundles we’ve seen to date. Head below to browse the full lineup of offers while they’re still live.
